intro: Sarcoglottis oaxacana, commonly known as the Oaxaca sarcoglottis, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Dioscoreaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and tuberous roots. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a rough texture, while the stems are hairy and vine-like. Sarcoglottis oaxacana is often found in tropical and subtropical regions with moist, well-drained soils.
